definition: see a worthy, think to imitate (idiom, from Analects); emulate the virtuous/Follow the example of a virtuous and wise teacher.
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to think/to consider
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
having both integrity and talent (idiom)
kind and charitable
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
loyal/sincere/sound
to follow through/to carry through to the end
school motto
to advise/to encourage
study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
hardworking and frugal
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
to carry out (obligation) conscientiously/to behave sincerely
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
(Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
